{"step_by_step_thinking": "Granulation tissue is composed of tissue matrix supporting a variety of cell types, most of which can be associated with one of the following functions: formation of extracellular matrix; operation of the immune system; vascularisation. The extracellular matrix of granulation tissue is initially composed of a network of type-III collagen, which is later replaced by the stronger, long-stranded type-I collagen. Therefore, the type of collagen found in granulation tissue is Type 1.", "answer_choice": "A"}
